From Lucas Perez to Takuma Asano - How Arsenal's 9 loan stars are doing around the world

[url]http://www.football.london/arsenal-fc/news/arsenal-loan-players-perez-asano-13775803.amp?service[]=responsive&service[]=tablet[/url]

9è™Ÿè®Šå·¦å¤–å€Ÿç‹
4ball good ball

Lucas Perez

The Spaniard sealed his dream return to Deportivo La Coruna just before the window shut following a summer of speculation.

It took him some time to find his fitness having been left out of Arsenal’s pre-season plans, but he is beginning to show signs of getting back to his best.

Perez has scored five goals in 14 games now for Deportivo, with all of those coming in his last 10 outings for the La Liga side.

Carl Jenkinson

The right-back joined Birmingham along with Cohen Bramall in a double loan deal but has endured a miserable start to his spell at St Andrews.

He lasted just 32 minutes of his debut against Reading before dislocating his shoulder and has only just returned to training in the past week.

While he’s been out Harry Redknapp - who signed him from Arsenal - has also been fired.

Cohen Bramall

Like Jenkinson, Bramall has not had the best of times since moving to St Andrews.

Cohen Bramall and Sead Kolasinac (Photo by David Price/Arsenal FC via Getty Images)
He played in the first two games following his move before dropping to the bench - he has not played sine.

Bramall initially impressed Birmingham fans with his attacking prowess and his pace down the flank, but the left-back was exposed defensively during his fleeting appearances with the Blues.

Joel Campbell

Arsenal’s forgotten man is spending the season on loan with Real Betis for the second time in his career.

A knee injury disrupted the early part of his time in Spain but he marked his first appearance back with a goal against Valencia.


Campbell went on to play another three games for Betis before getting injured again during the 1-0 defeat at Espanyol on October 30.

The ankle problem is still keeping him sidelined.
